001package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
002
003import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
004
005/**
006 * <p>
007 * Implementation of a D50-based XYZ color space, as a substitute for Java's
008 * built-in standard connection space (obtained with
009 * {@code  ColorSpace.getInstance(ColorSpace.CS_CIEXYZ)}), with improved
010 * accuracy. The reference white point of this color space is D50 and any XYZ
011 * coordinate passed to {@link #fromCIEXYZ(float[])} is assumed to be relative
012 * to D50 as well, thus no conversion (color adaptation) is necessary between
013 * XYZ values. See Sec. 14.1.1 of [1] for details.
014 * </p>
015 * <p>
016 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
017 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
018 * </p>
019 * 
020 * @author WB
021 * @version 2022/11/14
022 * @see XYZ65ColorSpace
023 */
024@SuppressWarnings("serial")
025public class XYZ50ColorSpace extends ColorSpace implements DirectD65Conversion {
026        private static sRgbColorSpace srgbCS = sRgbColorSpace.getInstance();
027        
028        private static final XYZ50ColorSpace instance = new XYZ50ColorSpace();
029        
030        public static XYZ50ColorSpace getInstance() {
031                return instance;
032        }
033        
034        private XYZ50ColorSpace() {
035                super(TYPE_XYZ, 3);
036        }
037
038        // -------------------------------------------------
039
040        @Override       // convert (D50-based) thisXyz to sRGB
041        public float[] toRGB(float[] thisXyz) {
042                return srgbCS.fromCIEXYZ(thisXyz);
043        }
044
045        @Override       // convert sRGB to (D50-based) thisXyz
046        public float[] fromRGB(float[] srgb) {
047                float[] thisXyz = srgbCS.toCIEXYZ(srgb);
048                return thisXyz;
049        }
050        
051        // -------------------------------------------------
052
053        @Override
054        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] thisXyz) {
055                return thisXyz; // nothing to do since D50-based XYZ already
056        }
057
058        @Override
059        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] xyz50) {
060                return xyz50;           // nothing to do, since D50-based XYZ is what we want
061        }
062        
063}
